revised_title: Diurnal Electric Currents and Their Connection with Magnetic Needle Variations
tldr: The author investigates alternating diurnal currents of electricity at the terrestrial surface and their connection with the diurnal variation of the horizontal magnetic needle. Observations made on the Midland Railway telegraph revealed simultaneous deflections in the four main lines, suggesting a connection between the direction of the electric current and the magnetic needle. Experiments showed a regular diurnal alternation in the electric current, with the deflection direction corresponding to easterly or westerly magnetic variation.
